 PREV   NEXT FRAMES    NO FRAMES    
Packages
org.texgen.gui Visual UI classes for displaying textures.

To get started with displaying a texture, just use :
TextureViewer.show(new TextureClass(),500,500,"My Texture");
org.texgen.signals Set of built-in signal classes that can be used as signal sources.
org.texgen.signals.modifier Signal classes that take a source signal and modify it to produce a new signal
org.texgen.textures This package contains the core interfaces and abstract class implementations for textures and signals.
org.texgen.textures.color Textures that are based on color and shading
org.texgen.textures.complex Set of complex textures built up out of other textures
org.texgen.textures.composite Textures used to compose multiple textures together based on alpha values or even based on a ChannelSignal value.
org.texgen.textures.demo Some demo textures from the how-to articles
org.texgen.textures.pattern Textures which are based on patterns and shapes
org.texgen.textures.signal Contains textures which depend on signals for their output
org.texgen.textures.uv Textures the modify the U,V inputs and then use those values to call the source texture.
org.texgen.utils Contains utility class to be used in textures and signals
